## Goals

- Quick course orientation
- Discuss the open science movement and the replication crisis
- Review research methods and design principles

## Instructions 

Work through each of the following Prep, Try, and Apply sections. 

- The **Prep** section will provide details on all the assigned material you need to complete that week on different days. 
- The  **Try** section will contain any slides/links that may be used during class. 
- The  **Apply** section will provide instructions about the formative and/or project assignment(s) due at the end of the week.

### Before Thursday

### After Thursday

- Read the paper: [Canvas link](https://bowdoin.instructure.com/courses/6255/files/728580?module_item_id=382042)

>> Savic, O., Unger, L., & Sloutsky, V. M. (2022). Exposure to co-occurrence regularities in language drives semantic integration of new words. <i>Journal of Experimental Psychology: Learning, Memory, and Cognition, 48</i>(7), 1064.

- Read the [QALMRI + SPARK tutorial](https://teaching-me.github.io/coglab/articles/course_docs/QALMRI_SPARK.html) on the course website

- Submit your Week 1 reflection and CITI certificate (due Sunday, see the [Apply](#apply) section)
